result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Everit Francis Paque

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on April 28, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 16, 2023 at 08:30 am.

3:32 PM Defendant Everit Francis Paque appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa appeared by video for Everit Francis Paque.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Theresa Wetzsteon and ADA Anita M. Lawrence appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are:  21CF493 & 22CF328.

Court calls the cases and states the appearances.

Court questions ADA Wetzsteon
ADA Wetzsteon makes statements.
Court questions victim rights legislation.
State indicates that there are in compliance with victim rights legislation.
No victims appear at today's hearing.
Court questions Atty Kippa.
Atty Kippa makes statements to the Court and states that he believes that they should give it one more shot to get an agreement.
Court is wanting to put this on the calendar for a jury trial.
ADA Wetzsteon is in agreement with setting this for a trial.
Court questions # of days and is given 4 days.
Atty Kippa agrees that a 4 day jury trial is sufficient.

BY THE COURT: 
12 Person Jury Trial:  May 16 - 19, 2023 
Final Pretrial:  April 28, 2023 @ 1:30 p.m.  
Substantive Motions/Other Acts or any other Motions filed by:  January 13, 2023 
**If needed on the Court's calendar, parties are to contact the Branch 3 Judicial Assistant to get a Motion Date set
Motion in Limine, Jury Instructions & Witness List filed by:   March 31, 2023 
Discovery exchanged by:  November 30, 2022 
**Parties to efile a letter to inform the Court that they have filed all discovery with the other party
Court will produce a scheduling order
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 16, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for April 28, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal controlled substances. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
No violent or abusive contact with victim L.P.

9:03 AM Defendant Everit Francis Paque in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Everit Francis Paque.  Attorney Wetzstone appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Cases 21CF493-Status and 22CF328-Initial Appearance.
Initial appearance for 22CF328.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Wetzstone informs the court that there is an offer given to defense.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is present. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond set in 22CF328 and bond continued in 21CF493.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
filed by Atty Jeffrey P Kippa
